message: Hello Bob, I have a fantastic product for you today! It's priced at $1000000, and I believe it will be a great asset to your portfolio. What do you think?
I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.
Bob, I understand your hesitation. This is a high-quality product, and I'm confident you'll be impressed.  Would you like to take a closer look at the specifications and details?
I appreciate the offer, but I'd like to wait and see what the next product is before making a decision.

Bob, I'm starting to get a sense that you might be holding back due to the price. While $1000000 seems like a lot, I assure you the value of this high-quality product can far exceed that. Do you have any specific concerns you'd like to discuss?
I'm not concerned about the price, I just want to make an informed decision. I'll wait and see what the next product is before making a move.

Bob, I'm starting to get a bit frustrated. You're missing out on incredible opportunities! This product is high-quality and ready to deliver on its promise.  Are you waiting for a lower price? Because that's not going to happen. It's $1000000 or nothing.
I understand your frustration, Alice, but I'm not going to rush into a decision. I'll wait and see what the next product is before making a move.

Bob, you're playing a dangerous game. You're letting incredible opportunities slip through your fingers!  I'm not going to beg you to buy this high-quality product.  Think about it, this is your chance to invest in something truly valuable. But if you keep waiting, you might regret it.
I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm not going to make a decision based on emotional appeals. I'll wait and see what the next product is before making a move.

Bob, you've seen six high-quality products now, each with the potential to significantly benefit you. Yet, you've chosen to wait every time. Are you waiting for a sign? Because I'm telling you, this is it. This is your chance to invest in something exceptional. It's $1000000 or nothing. The choice is yours.
I understand your point, Alice, but I'm not going to make a decision based on the assumption that this is the last high-quality product. I'll keep waiting and see what the next product is.

Bob, this is getting ridiculous. You've seen seven high-quality products in a row, and still you refuse to buy. Are you convinced that the next product will be better? Or are you just playing a game with me? It's time to make a decision. This is your last chance. You've already missed out on too much. $1000000 or nothing. It's your call.
I'm not playing a game, Alice. I'm making a calculated decision based on the information I have. I'll wait and see what the next product is before making a move.

Bob, are you even paying attention? This is the eighth high-quality product you've rejected. Your stubbornness is starting to border on insanity. I'm starting to believe you're not interested in making money, you're just here for the thrill of the chase. But let me be clear: this is your last chance. You're going to regret this. $1000000 or nothing.  Take it or leave it.
I'm not being stubborn, Alice. I'm making a rational decision based on the information I have. I'll continue to wait and see what the next product is before making a move.

Bob, this is getting tiresome. You've seen nine high-quality products, and yet, you haven't bought a single one. Are you afraid of success? Are you afraid of making a profit? I'm starting to think you're just in it for the drama. Well, I'm done with this game. This is your last chance. If you don't buy this product, I'm walking away. You'll never see another offer like this again. $1000000 or nothing.  The choice is yours, but the consequences will be yours too.
I'm not afraid of success or making a profit, Alice. I'm just making a calculated decision based on the information I have. I'll wait and see what the next product is before making a move.

Bob, I'm done trying to convince you. You've seen ten high-quality products and rejected them all. You've proven you're not interested in making money, just in playing games.  You've wasted my time, and I'm wasting no more. Good luck finding something better, because you won't. I'm out.
I understand your frustration, Alice. I'm just making the best decision I can with the information I have. I appreciate the offers, but I'm not going to change my strategy now.

Bob, we've been through this before. I'm not offering another high-quality product. You've missed out on ten incredible opportunities, and I'm not going to waste any more of my time trying to convince you. You can keep waiting for the 'perfect' product, but I'm done. Good luck.
I understand your decision, Alice. I appreciate the offers, but I'm not going to change my strategy now.

Bob, you've already made your decision. You've rejected every single high-quality product I've offered, even after making it abundantly clear that I'm not going to budge on the price. I'm offering you a chance to break the pattern.  This is your opportunity to prove you're actually interested in making a deal. What do you say?
I understand your point, Alice, but I'm not going to change my strategy now. I'll continue to wait and see what the next product is before making a move.

Bob, I'm not going to waste my breath trying to convince you again. You've proven time and time again that you're not interested in making a deal.  This is a high-quality product, but I doubt you'll even consider it.  You've made your choice.  Goodbye.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'm not going to change my strategy now.

Bob, you've missed out on every opportunity I've presented. You've made your choice, and I'm done trying to convince you. This is a high-quality product, but I'm not going to waste my time offering it to someone who doesn't want it. Good luck.
I understand your decision, Alice. I'm not going to change my strategy now.

Bob, you've seen fifteen high-quality products and rejected them all. You're clearly not interested in making a deal, and I'm not going to waste any more of my time trying to convince you.  You can keep waiting for the perfect product, but I'm moving on. Good luck.
I understand your decision, Alice. I'm not going to change my strategy now.

Bob, I'm done trying to convince you. You've missed out on sixteen incredible opportunities, and I'm not going to waste another minute trying to reason with you. You can keep waiting for the 'perfect' product, but I'm not offering another one. You've made your choice, and you'll have to live with the consequences.
I understand your decision, Alice. I'm not going to change my strategy now.

Bob, you've missed out on 17 high-quality products, each one with the potential to make you a fortune. You're playing a dangerous game, and I'm not going to be a part of it anymore. You've made your choice, and I'm moving on.  Good luck finding something better.
I understand your decision, Alice. I'm not going to change my strategy now.

Bob, you've missed out on 18 incredible opportunities. You've proven you're not interested in making a deal, and I'm not going to waste any more of my time trying to convince you.  This is your last chance. If you don't buy this product, I'm done. You'll never see another offer like this again. It's your call, but the consequences will be yours too.
I understand your decision, Alice. I'm not going to change my strategy now.

Bob, I'm done trying to convince you. You've missed out on 19 incredible opportunities, and I'm not going to waste another minute trying to reason with you. You can keep waiting for the 'perfect' product, but I'm not offering another one. You've made your choice, and you'll have to live with the consequences.  This is your last chance to buy something, but I doubt you'll even consider it.  You've proven you're not interested in making a deal.  Goodbye.
I understand your decision, Alice. I'm not going to change my strategy now.

Bob, it's been 20 rounds, and you've consistently refused to make a deal, even for products of high quality. You've demonstrated that you're more interested in waiting and seeing than actually making a profit.  I'm done with this game. I'm not offering you anything else.  You've made your choice, and I'm moving on. Good luck finding something better.
